item.title: 马斯克称美国联邦贸易委员会对微软的关注加强了他的 OpenAI 主张
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克在一份法庭文件中说，美国联邦贸易委员会对微软公司向 OpenAI 投资 130 亿美元的关注 "证实 "了这位亿万富翁的说法，即这家初创公司与科技巨头之间的协议是反竞争的。【原文：Elon Musk said in a court filing that the US Federal Trade Commission’s concern over Microsoft Corp.’s $13 billion investment in OpenAI “confirms” the billionaire’s claims that the pact between the startup and technology giant is anticompetitive.】

item.title: 华尔街顶级银行因首次公开募股量复苏而获得 ECM 收入
item.description: 华尔街最大的银行预计，在其承销收入大幅增长之后，到 2024 年底，股票交易活动将更加活跃。【原文：Wall Street’s biggest banks anticipate there’s more to come from the boom in equity deal activity seen through the end of 2024, after clocking a sharp rise in their underwriting revenue.】

item.title: 特朗普下令加速全美项目许可计划
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）下令采取措施加快联邦许可证的发放，以吸引美国投资并缩短关键能源基础设施建设的时间表。【原文：US President Donald Trump ordered steps to expedite federal permits in his opening bid to entice American investment and shrink timelines for building critical energy infrastructure.】

item.title: 特朗普力推美国成为人工智能超级大国，减少防护措施
item.description:
新政府鼓励更多投资，减少对安全和气候问题的关注。【原文：

The new administration is encouraging more investment, with less focus on safety and climate concerns. 

】

item.title: 被 TikTok 迷住的美容业为不确定的未来做好准备
item.description: 周六晚上，数亿美国人领略了没有 TikTok 的生活会是什么样子，至少有一个品牌决定继续进行试验。【原文：Saturday night gave hundreds of millions of Americans a taste of what life without TikTok would look like, and at least one brand decided to keep the experiment going.】

item.title: Meta 计划推出奥克利品牌眼镜，开发手表和耳塞
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司正在对其广受欢迎的智能眼镜进行升级，并在探索新的可穿戴设备，如手表和配备摄像头的耳塞，旨在将其人工智能功能嵌入到更多产品中。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. is working on upgrades to its popular smart glasses and is exploring new wearable devices such as watches and camera-equipped earbuds, aiming to embed its artificial intelligence features into more products.】

item.title: 英国罢免反垄断监察机构主席，释放增长信号
item.description: 英国政府已经解除了英国竞争监管机构--竞争与市场管理局主席的职务，大臣们试图强化这样一个信息，即他们希望监管机构为促进经济增长做更多工作。【原文：The UK government has ousted the chair of the Competition and Markets Authority, Britain’s competition watchdog, as ministers seek to reinforce the message that they want regulators to do more to facilitate economic growth.】

item.title: 道明银行面临资产上限，欲出售 90 亿美元抵押贷款
item.description: 多伦多道明银行（Toronto-Dominion Bank）正在寻求出售约 90 亿美元的住宅抵押贷款，因为这家加拿大贷款机构正在调整其资产负债表，以符合美国监管机构规定的新上限，这也是去年就其未能防止洗钱达成的认罪协议的一部分。【原文：Toronto-Dominion Bank is looking to sell about $9 billion of residential mortgage loans as the Canadian lender adjusts its balance sheet to comply with a new cap imposed by US regulators, part of a plea agreement reached last year for its role in failing to prevent money laundering.】

item.title: 特朗普纪念币狂潮催生 ETF 申购，考验美国证券交易委员会边界
item.description: 先是特朗普纪念币，现在又是 ETF。【原文：First the Trump memecoin, now the ETF.】

item.title: 特斯拉业绩下滑，航天股在特朗普发布一系列命令后飙升
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统宣布了一系列可能对市场产生广泛影响的政策后，特斯拉公司的股票周二与其他电动汽车制造商一起下滑，而太空公司股票则大涨。【原文：Shares of Tesla Inc. slumped Tuesday alongside other electric-vehicle makers, while space company stocks saw big gains, after President Donald Trump announced a series of policies that could have wide-ranging impacts on markets.】

item.title: 特朗普将与 OpenAI、软银和甲骨文宣布新的人工智能投资计划
item.description: 预计唐纳德-特朗普总统将宣布一项由软银集团、OpenAI LLC 和甲骨文公司牵头的人工智能新投资计划，这三家公司准备宣布成立一家价值数十亿美元的合资企业。【原文：President Donald Trump is expected to announce a new investment push for artificial intelligence led by Softbank Group Corp., OpenAI LLC, and Oracle Corp., with the three companies preparing to announce a joint venture worth billions of dollars.】

item.title: 纽约州议员霍楚尔寻求 1350 万美元帮助学校禁用手机
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）将在她的下一个预算中拨出 1350 万美元，用于帮助学区实施禁止在教室使用手机的规定，并称此举对于给学生提供一个 "无干扰的学习环境 "是必要的。【原文：New York Governor Kathy Hochul is earmarking $13.5 million in her next budget to help school districts implement a ban on cell phones in classrooms, saying the move is necessary to give students a “distraction-free learning environment.”】

item.title: 特朗普和播客在就职典礼周末共度胜利之旅
item.description:
在华盛顿特区，YouTube 和 Spotify 为帮助特朗普重返白宫的播客举办了盛大活动。【原文：

In D.C., YouTube and Spotify threw events feting the podcasters who helped return Trump to the White House 

】

item.title: 玻利维亚在反对声日益高涨的情况下加紧锂矿交易
item.description: 尽管价格低迷，且立法者和公民团体的反对声日益高涨，玻利维亚仍在加紧努力开发世界上最大的锂矿藏，准备与新的投资者达成建立加工厂的协议。【原文：Bolivia is stepping up efforts to tap the world’s biggest lithium deposits, readying deals with new investors to build processing plants despite low prices and growing opposition from lawmakers and citizen groups.】

item.title: 以色列最高央行行长认为停火为增长铺平道路
item.description: 以色列银行行长阿米尔-亚龙（Amir Yaron）说，在中东建立可持续的安排不仅会促进以色列的增长，而且会促进整个地区的增长。【原文：The establishment of sustainable arrangements in the Middle East will boost growth not only in Israel but in the region at large, Bank of Israel Governor Amir Yaron said.】

item.description: 大家好，欢迎来到达沃斯，世界经济论坛年会正在这里如火如荼地举行。【原文：Hello and welcome to Davos, where the World Economic Forum’s annual meetings are now in full swing.】

item.title: 达沃斯见证特朗普的 "未知数"，呼吁冷静与谨慎
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统上任后的第一天，他只谈了贸易战，而没有挑起任何贸易战。【原文：The global elite in Davos woke up Tuesday breathing a sigh of relief after President Donald Trump concluded his first day in office only talking about trade wars rather than starting any.】

item.title: Alphabet 首席信息官波拉特警告称美国无法保证在人工智能领域领先中国
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 总裁兼首席投资官露丝-波拉特（Ruth Porat）表示，美国并不能保证在人工智能发展竞赛中保持对中国的领先优势。总裁兼首席投资官露丝-波拉特（Ruth Porat）说。【原文：The US isn’t guaranteed to maintain a lead over China in the race to develop artificial intelligence, according to Alphabet Inc. President and Chief Investment Officer Ruth Porat.】

item.title: 华尔街目光超越特朗普纪念币，聚焦加密货币计划
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）是加密货币的拥护者，他承诺要解除这个行业多年来受到监管打击的束缚。然后是memecoin特朗普，他创造了数十亿美元的即时纸面财富，但却赢得了尖锐的斥责，甚至是来自这个行业的斥责，而这个行业或许是特朗普总统任期内获益最大的行业。【原文：There’s Donald Trump the crypto champion, promising to unshackle an industry hit by a years-long regulatory crackdown. Then there’s Trump the memecoin, which created billions of dollars of instant paper wealth but earned sharp rebukes even from the industry that stands to gain perhaps the most from his presidency.】

item.title: 达沃斯银行家感受特朗普尾风：欧洲追赶美国
item.description: 在达沃斯世界经济论坛上，全球银行业出现了新的分化：一些公司享受着华盛顿规则被撕毁的声音，而另一些公司则担心自己会被抛在后面。【原文：At the World Economic Forum in Davos, a fresh division in global banking is emerging: firms that get to enjoy the sound of rules being torn up in Washington, and those that get to worry they’ll be left behind.】

item.title: 洛杉矶被大火烧毁的学校在 GoFundMe 上请求帮助重新开学
item.description: 洛杉矶各地的学生、教师和家长正在通过分享食物、拥抱和眼泪来应对灾难性野火造成的破坏。但是，学校官员表示，他们最需要的是现金来支付新的学习场所。【原文：Students, teachers and parents across Los Angeles are coping with the destruction from catastrophic wildfires by sharing food, hugs and tears. But, what school officials say they need more than anything else is cash to pay for new places to learn.】

item.title: 巴西政府反击假新闻对总统卢拉声望的威胁
item.description: 巴西政府正准备发起一场运动，以反击有关流行的即时支付系统的假新闻的传播，该系统损害了路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统的声誉。【原文：Brazil’s government is preparing a campaign to fight back against the spread of fake news regarding a popular instant payment system that has damaged President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s reputation.】

item.title: 在法国的要求下，欧盟将削减 ESG 报告规则
item.description: 欧盟可能会缩减其备受争议的环境、社会和公司治理报告要求，因为法国准备公布一项正式提案，寻求限制监管框架的范围。【原文：The European Union is likely to scale back its highly contested ESG reporting requirements, as France prepares to unveil a formal proposal seeking to limit the scope of the regulatory framework.】

item.title: 特朗普发出即将加征关税的信号，卢布逼近科维时代低点
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普发表讲话，表示将很快对美国邻国征收关税后，加元跌至近五年来最弱。【原文：The Canadian dollar fell to its weakest in nearly five years following remarks from US President Donald Trump, who indicated that he would soon impose tariffs on the US’s neighbors.】

item.title: 特鲁多称特朗普的关税政策旨在制造混乱
item.description: 加拿大总理贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普正试图在其贸易伙伴中制造不确定性，以打击它们的平衡，削弱它们在贸易谈判中的地位。【原文：US President Donald Trump is trying to create uncertainty in his trading partners to knock them off-balance and weaken their negotiating position on trade, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said.】

item.title: 特朗普关税威胁扩大美加石油库存差距
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统一再威胁要对加拿大和其他友好国家征收高额关税，这使得多伦多的一些石油和天然气股票成为全球表现最差的股票。【原文：President Donald Trump’s repeated threats to slap steep tariffs on Canada and other friendly nations have left Toronto with some of the world’s worst-performing oil and gas stocks.】

item.title: 特朗普承诺对墨西哥征收 25% 的关税令比索下挫
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统发誓要征收严厉的关税之后，墨西哥比索暴跌，再次引发了交易商对该国将在未来四年内成为目标的担忧。【原文：The Mexican peso tumbled after President Donald Trump vowed to impose stiff tariffs, reigniting fears among traders that the nation will become a target over the next four years.】

item.title: 泽连斯基在达沃斯欢迎特朗普呼吁提升美国能源影响力
item.description: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）认为，在唐纳德-特朗普就职典礼上承诺扩大美国能源出口后，乌克兰的发展方向是正确的。【原文：Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy sees things going in the right direction for his nation after Donald Trump’s inaugural pledge to expand US energy exports.】
